result.execSummary:
The defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1. The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 
2. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.
Defendant shall complete a criminal thinking program.

records.addlTxt: DOC restitution order
DOC Restitution Order

ADDRESS INFO for Kongmong Alvin Yang
Current: Minnesota Correctional Facility - Faribault, 1101 Linden Lane, Faribault, MN 55021 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2022)
Prior: 1667 Conway St, Saint Paul, MN 55106 United States

10:44 AM Called 22CF38 for PLEAS.  Defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang in court in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Kongmong Alvin Yang.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. PLQ filed, def has reviewed with Attny.  Offer of 2 years of probation plus restitution of $150.  ADA confirms in vic rights compliance.  Agreement confirmed by Attny Erdman.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties. Def understands.  Court reviews definition of a withheld sentence vs. imposed and stayed sentence.  Def understands.  Court may use PC to find a factual basis.  Court asks for plea. 
Def enters a plea of Guilty of Conspiracy to Commit Uttering a Forgery.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement, no criminal history in WI however reviews MN cases and offenses. Def confirms at MN Faribault then on parole 6 mo and programing 6-9 mo.  Attorney Erdman makes a statement and asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the court.

Court Orders: 
2 years of probation, may transfer to MN, call probation, imposed and stayed - 12 months of incarceration in county jail, Conditions do criminal thinking program, look into trades / trade school.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
$150 restitution
$518 court costs, fines and fees
Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building. Need Fingerprints.  Def asks for confirmation, would get jail credit for time served here. Attorney Erdman states 72 days jail credit. Report to probation.
Plea Agreement

10:10 AM Defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Kongmong Alvin Yang.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def in Barron County- makes speaking to def difficult (won't allow phone calls, has to go in person), offer is for 2 yrs probation, plead as charged.  State notes restitution request $150.  Discussion of in-person plea/sentencing; def wants to be in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Kongmong Alvin Yang. Def appears from Barron County Jail.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: no offer received yet, def open to resolution.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney James Rennicke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Kongmong Alvin Yang.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kongmong Alvin Yang in court. Defendant in custody.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Court inquired off the record if def has applied for PD- has not, wishes to proceed today.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def must contact PD and get atty as soon as possible.  Discussion of return to MN- def cannot return to MN until case is resolved (detainer).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
